data.name: label2.Text
data.value: 1. Upon opening this form, all positions set by this form will have been set to zero 2. Using the Plot form, set the observed chord for the main star to match the asteroid profile at the northern limb, then click 'Set the North chord' below. 3. Using the Plot form, set the observed chord for the main star to match the asteroid profile at the southern limb, then click 'Set the South chord' below. 4. When you are satisfied with the fit of the North and South chords, click 'Set the Offsets and CLOSE' below. The values will be set on the Double Star Solution form. NOTE: References to North and South are indicative only. The important issue is for the chords to be on opposite sides of the asteroid, which might be East/West.

data.name: label1.Text
data.value: This form is used to set the two possible locations of the asteroid relative to the chord of the 'Main' star. This serves two functions: i. it provides the average position of the asteroid relative to the Main component, for use in deriving astrometry from the event ii. it sets the basis for determining the 4 possible solutions for the star's separation and position angle.

data.name: label5.Text
data.value: This form requires you to locate the chord on opposite sides of the asteroid, and set the 'North' and 'South' chord locations. If the chord is similar to, or greater than, the asteroid diameter, you will not be able to do this. In this situation, close this form, and analyse the event as a two-solution event, with this chord aligned with the center of the asteroid.
